result.execSummary:
The defendant Jadonte Viceaoned Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 104 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment;  If Revoked, payments of costs, fees and surcharges are to be paid from a percentage of prison wages deemed appropriate.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
-Court waived all non mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay
-Court orders restitution set at $0.00.

-No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession,body armor, ammunition/explosives.

-No Driving without a valid license.
-No violation of the law rising to the level of probable cause.

-Provide DNA sample.
-Cooperate with agent as to all home and office visits.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jadonte Viceaoned Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS, with credit for 104 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS. 
The defendant ISeligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No violation of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
-Cooperate with agent as to all home and office visits.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment;
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent;
-No contact with firearms
-6 MONTH Drivers License Revocation
-Provide DNA sample;
-No Driving without a valid license.
-Provide a DNA sample.
-Obtain GED/HSED or Diploma
-Provide 25 hours of community service.
-Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment;  If Revoked, payments of costs, fees and surcharges are to be paid from a percentage of prison wages deemed appropriate.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
-Court waived all non mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay
-Court orders restitution set at $0.00

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession,body armor, ammunition/explosives.

*Court advised defendant Expungment is not appropriate in this case, Expungment DNIED.   mn
Filed: 

Memorandum of Conditions of Probation;
Pretrial Sentence Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief;

Defendant Jadonte Viceaoned Johnsonappeared from the MCap Program/CCC and  in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Order to Produce GF-190 - PLEAS - 06-24-22; _1 - Johnson, Jadonte Viceaoned..  Filed.
Order to Produce GF-190 - PLEAS - 06-24-22; _1 - Johnson, Jadonte Viceaoned.docx
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY  HEARING (11  pages) commencing 04-14-22  by Kathleen S. Worden.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jadonte Viceaoned Johnson not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant not produced for this hearing. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Jadonte V Johnson in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Jadonte V Johnson in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Schwabenlander. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jadonte V Johnson in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BOTH APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jadonte V Johnson in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Jadonte V Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jadonte V Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
